snippet: In a clinical trial involving 386 people, participants who received a form of vitamin B3 had a lower risk of getting non-melanoma skin cancer than those who received a placebo.
abstract: Australian researchers unveil results of clinical trial finding that inexpensive form of vitamin B3, known as nicotinamide, could reduce risk of non-melanoma skin cancer by 23 percent.
lead_paragraph: In a clinical trial involving 386 people, participants who received a form of vitamin B3 had a lower risk of getting non-melanoma skin cancer than those who received a placebo.

headline.main: B Vitamin Is Found to Help People Prone to Some Types of Skin Cancer
headline.print_headline: Australian Study Finds a Form of Vitamin B Helps Some People With Skin Cancer
